reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Improve the protection and wellbeing of displaced children and their families by delivering life-saving integrated emergency Protection, Nutrition, and Health interventions

description.narrative: SR aims to continue providing integrated emergency Protection, CP, and HMA services to newly displaced girls, women, boys, and men in Idleb Gov. The services will be delivered during a seven month period starting from 1st of Apr-20, addressing the identified Protection needs of the targeted beneficiaries. The Overall Project Protection Objective is designed to provide integrated protection services through the emergency module. The outcome of Protection part will be Conflict and weather affected IDPs, including PwD, are better supported through case management and referral services, provision of IPA, risk education about UXOs, and capacitated front-line service providers This Outcome has been informed by the ASO 1 as outlined in the 2020 1st RA. Protection services are intended to provide a comprehensive emergency package of essential services to affected IDPs through expanding the capacity of static service points and mobile outreach teams. The sites targeted under this Intervention have been identified based on the Protection Cluster recommendations as they are densely populated with newly IDPs who displaced from south and east of Idleb in addition to IPDs from western Aleppo. there will be flexibility in targeting specific camps within the suggested subdistricts according to the need and gap in service provision. The project is designed to continue delivering the current emergency CP services that SR is delivering through 2 mobile units in Idleb and Aleppo, in addition to adding 2 mobile units and establishing 2 Help Desks in 2 current CFSs supported by SR. Moreover, the protection emergency services will be expanded to include the provision of Case Management and IPA to most vulnerable women and men, Protection Monitoring, distributing IEC materials on Risk Education, and distribution first aid kits to newly established CFSs/learning spaces within camps. In total, the Protection services aim to reach approximately 6680 affected and newly displaced girls, women, boys, and men in Harim, Idleb, and Jisr-Ash-Shugur Dist. with integrated Protection, CP and RE services, in addition to Nutrition and Health services, which will provide a secure and supportive environment, building on existing capacities within the local communities and expanding the population of SR response team. SR Protection Teams will implement all Project activities directly with support from SR Turkey Office. Protection emergency response will be delivered in integration with Nutrition services. Through the nutrition mobile units/RRTs and extended activities, SR will deliver services to caregivers to support and uphold recommended practices related to maternal, infant and young child nutrition as well as mid-upper arm circumference MUAC screening, and referral of identified cases of malnutrition for treatment if and when applicable. Nutrition Mobile units will accompany Protection teams and continue to provide individual counselling on maternal nutrition for pregnant women, breastfeeding (early initiation of breastfeeding, exclusive and continued breastfeeding, relactation, breastfeeding troubleshooting) and complementary feeding, as well as group education sessions to provide opportunities for caregivers to learn and share experiences on the recommended nutrition practices. In addition, the Nutrition Teams will identify the most vulnerable individuals who have Protection concerns and refer them to the Protection Team. They will also receive cases of malnutrition and PLWs that Protection teams may identify and refer. All Project activities will be delivered in Idleb and Harim districts, following Cluster approach in responding to new influxes of displacement. There will be a recruitment and training of newly hired staff on relative needed Pro and Nut themes during the first month. Then SR will coordinate with local councils of targeted locations and deliver the project services during the remaining 6 months through the 4 mobile units and 2 Help D.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
